meanings.definition: A person who is excessively proper or fussy.
meanings.sent1: The prissies in the group always made sure everything was perfectly arranged.
meanings.sent2: She was known as one of the prissies in the office due to her meticulous attention to detail.
meanings.sent3: The prissies at the tea party insisted on using only the finest china.
meanings.sent4: Her room was so neat and tidy, it looked like the home of a prissies.
meanings.sent5: The prissies in the class always raised their hands first to answer questions.

meanings.definition: To act in a prim or fussy manner.
meanings.sent1: She prissies around the house, making sure everything is in its place.
meanings.sent2: Don't prissies over the details; sometimes it's okay to be a little messy.
meanings.sent3: He prissies about his appearance, spending hours in front of the mirror.
meanings.sent4: The cat prissies around the room, avoiding any spot that seems dirty.
meanings.sent5: She prissies over her outfit, trying on multiple combinations before choosing one.

meanings.definition: Plural form of prissy, meaning overly prim or fussy.
meanings.sent1: The prissies decorations in her room made it look like a dollhouse.
meanings.sent2: Their prissies attitudes made it difficult to relax and have fun around them.
meanings.sent3: The prissies cupcakes at the party were almost too pretty to eat.
meanings.sent4: The garden was filled with prissies flowers, each one perfectly arranged.
meanings.sent5: Her prissies manners sometimes made others feel uncomfortable in her presence.
